info.title: Splox API
info.description: Run workflows, manage chats, receive events, and monitor execution via the Splox API

get.description: Lists all workflows owned by the authenticated user. Supports cursor-based pagination and search.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (UUID of last item from previous page)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter by workflow name or description

get.description: Retrieves a workflow with its draft version, all nodes, and all edges.
Retrieves the latest version of a workflow by highest version number.
Retrieves the start nodes for a workflow version. The `id` parameter is a workflow version ID, not a workflow ID.
Lists all versions of a workflow.

post.description: Triggers a workflow execution. Creates a workflow request with the given payload, enqueues it for processing, and returns a workflow_request_id for tracking.

workflow_version_id.description: ID of the workflow version to execute

chat_id.description: Chat session ID (used for context memory and SSE streaming)

start_node_id.description: ID of the Start node to begin execution at

query.description: The user message or query text. Available as {{ start.text }} in the workflow.

files.description: Optional file attachments. Available as {{ start.files }} in the workflow.

additional_params.description: Optional extra parameters merged into the payload

workflow_request_id.description: ID of the created workflow request. Use this to listen for results, get the execution tree, or check status.

400.description: Bad request — invalid input or unauthorized

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (max 20 per minute per user)

post.description: Executes a tool directly on an MCP server configured by the authenticated user.

mcp_server_id.description: ID of the user MCP server to execute against

structuredContent.description: Optional structured output from MCP tool

400.description: Bad request — missing or invalid input

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (max 30 per minute per user)

post.description: Receives an event from an external service via the Event Hub. The event is stored and routed to subscribed agents. Supports verification challenges for Slack and Facebook/Instagram.

requestBody.description: Any JSON payload from the external service. Stored as-is and routed to subscribed agents.

ok.description: Whether the event was stored successfully

get.description: Streams real-time execution updates via Server-Sent Events as the workflow runs. First sends all existing node executions, then streams updates in real-time via Redis PubSub.

200.description: SSE stream of execution events. Each event contains a workflow_request and/or node_execution update. Keepalive messages sent every 3 seconds. Connection times out after 30 minutes.

get.description: Retrieves the complete execution tree showing all nodes, their status, inputs, outputs, and child agent executions. Max recursion depth: 10.
Retrieves cursor-based paginated execution history for a workflow.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (UUID of last item from previous page)

next_cursor.description: Cursor for next page. Null if no more results.

get.description: Lists all chat sessions for a specific resource (workflow, agent, etc.).

post.description: Creates a new chat session for a workflow or other resource. The chat ID is required when running workflows via the API.

name.description: Display name for the chat session

resource_type.description: Type of resource this chat is associated with

resource_id.description: ID of the resource (workflow ID, agent ID, etc.)

get.description: Retrieves a chat session by ID. Users can only access their own chats.

delete.description: Deletes a chat session by ID.

get.description: Retrieves paginated chat message history. Returns a bare JSON array of messages, newest first.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: RFC3339 timestamp cursor for backward pagination. Omit to get latest messages.

200.description: Chat messages retrieved successfully (bare JSON array)

delete.description: Deletes all message history for a chat session. The chat session itself is preserved.

get.description: Streams real-time chat updates via Server-Sent Events. Subscribes to the chat's Redis channel and streams workflow request updates and node execution events for the chat session. Keepalive every 3 seconds, 30-minute timeout.

200.description: SSE stream of chat events. Includes workflow request status updates and node execution events for the chat session.

WorkflowVersion.description: Represents a specific version of a workflow

WorkflowFull.description: Complete workflow with version, nodes, and edges

Node.description: Represents a node in a workflow

next_cursor.description: Cursor for next page. Null if no more results.

workflow_version_id.description: ID of the workflow version being executed

start_node_id.description: ID of the Start node execution began at

user_id.description: ID of the user who owns the workflow

billing_user_id.description: ID of the user being billed for this execution

parent_node_execution_id.description: ID of parent node execution (for child agent invocations)

parent_workflow_request_id.description: ID of parent workflow request (same as id for root requests)

chat_id.description: Chat session ID associated with this execution

payload.description: Input payload passed to the Start node

NodeExecution.description: Represents the execution state of a single node

ChatMessage.description: A single message in a chat history

ChatMessageContent.description: A single content block within a chat message

toolName.description: Name of the tool being called

WorkflowRequestFile.description: File attached to a workflow request

bearerAuth.description: API token generated from your Splox account settings. Create tokens at https://app.splox.io/account?tab=settings
